title: Interesting movie, might watch again
review: Although the first hour is really slow, the movie got me interested till the end. No jumpscares or bloody-bath scenes, it relies on the ambient it creates and the interesting plot to get you through the length of the film.Might watch again because I had a feeling I had missed some things after I saw it.

title: Deadlong
review: The ending scene with Wade dying summarizes the whole movie pretty well. It lingers on and on and on with no added value whatsoever.Jokes were not funny, predictable movie altogether. Just milking on the success of the first one without anything new worth for it.

title: Thor will return in Avengers: Infinity War
review: A 2-hourish long, slow-paced, not enough action-packed prologue to Avengers: Infinity War. Mildly interesting...

title: Overrated nostalgia
review: Don't take me wrong, I enjoyed the movie: great soundtrack, stuffed with pop culture references... but that was mostly all about it... Plot is sligtly bloated and there's no much more 'juice' in it.Worth to watch just for the nostalgia and even has replay value to spot all references... I will surely listen to the OST more than once though.

title: Popcorn fest!
review: Comedy and action at equal parts. Grab the biggest bucket of popcorn and your favourite soda and enjoy!Yeah, the plot is meh but as long as you have popcorn in the bucket, why bother...Best thing after Guardians of the Galaxy 2.

title: The Room costed over 6M $?
review: Watched this after 'The Room' and the most shocking fact was realising the original movie costed over 6M dollars... I thought that was a low budget movie at most a few thousand dollars budget.About this movie, nothing substantial except the interpretation of James Franco. For the rest pretty dull and boring movie to just get into the making of The Room.

title: Food with a pretty bad taste
review: Full of racial stereotypes and sexual references. This is the dumbest movie I remember.

title: Fantastic experience!
review: Weird experience in the best possible way. Will keep you on the edge of your seat all along.
